intro: Brodiaea torreyi, commonly known as the Torrey's brodiaea, is a species of flowering plant in the family Asparagaceae. It is native to the western United States, particularly found in California and Nevada. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. It produces small, white or pale purple flowers in clusters during the spring. Its bulbs are an important food source for various insects and small animals.
